net.greghaines.jesque.worker

Interface Worker

  • All Superinterfaces:
    JobExecutor, Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    WorkerImpl, WorkerPool, WorkerPoolImpl

    public interface Worker
extends JobExecutor, Runnable
    A Worker polls for Jobs from a specified list of queues, executing them in sequence and notifying WorkerListeners in the process.

    Workers are designed to be run in a Thread or an ExecutorService. E.g.: 

     final Worker worker = new WorkerImpl(config, Worker.ALL_QUEUES, 
                Arrays.asList("TestAction"));
 final Thread t = new Thread(worker);
 t.start();
 Thread.yield();
 ...
 worker.end();
 t.join();
    Author:
    Greg Haines

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface net.greghaines.jesque.worker.JobExecutor

        JobExecutor.State

      static Collection<String> ALL_QUEUES
      Special value to tell a Worker to poll all currently available queues.

    • Field Detail

      • ALL_QUEUES

        static final Collection<String> ALL_QUEUES
        Special value to tell a Worker to poll all currently available queues.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of this Worker.
        Returns:
        the name of this Worker

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()
        Returns whether this worker is paused.
        Returns:
        whether this worker is paused. If true, the worker is not processing any new jobs; if false, the worker is processing new jobs

      • togglePause

        void togglePause(boolean paused)
        Toggle whether this worker will process any new jobs.
        Parameters:
        paused - if true, the worker will not process any new jobs; if false, the worker will process new jobs

      • getQueues

        Collection<String> getQueues()
        The queues that this Worker will poll.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable view of the queues to be polled

      • addQueue

        void addQueue(String queueName)
        Poll the given queue. If the queue exists multiple times, it will be checked that many times per loop. This allows for a queue to be given higher priority by checking it more often.
        Parameters:
        queueName - the name of the queue to poll

      • removeQueue

        void removeQueue(String queueName,
                 boolean all)
        Stop polling the given queue. If the all argument is true, all instances of the queue will be removed, otherwise, only one instance is removed.
        Parameters:
        queueName - the queue to stop polling
        all - whether to remove all or only one of the instances

      • removeAllQueues

        void removeAllQueues()
        Stop polling all queues.

      • setQueues

        void setQueues(Collection<String> queues)
        Clear any current queues and poll the given queues in the order returned by the Collection's iterator.
        Parameters:
        queues - the queues to poll

      • getWorkerEventEmitter

        WorkerEventEmitter getWorkerEventEmitter()
        Returns:
        the worker event emitter for this worker
